intro: Hevea brasiliensis var. janeirensis, commonly known as the Brazilian rubber tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It is renowned for its latex-producing properties, which are harvested for natural rubber production. The plant has a dense canopy and can grow up to 30 meters tall, with dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically appearing in clusters, and it relies on specific pollinators for reproduction. The tree plays a vital role in both ecological systems and the global rubber industry.
